content: speed bumps by steepndeep designs this easy 2 row reversible textured design is perfect for either a scarf or cowl patterns for both are included materials yarn of your choice and needle size to obtain desired texture a smooth non-variegated or long color change yarn is recommended in order to better show the textured pattern design yarn needle for weaving in ends and for optional kitchener bind off the scarf in photo was knit on us 10 ½ needles with 4 ½ oz of worsted weight yarn and is 4 ½ x 70 for scarf cast on 26 stitches to make it wider or narrower add or remove stitches in groups of 4 knit sections a and b alternately until desired length achieved ending after completing a section a bind off in pattern for cowl using provisional method cast on 34 stitches knit sections a and b alternately until piece measures approximately 60 or until desired length graft two ends together using kitchener stitch or if you prefer not to use provisional cast on stitches knit as above bind off in pattern then sew two ends together section a section b row 1 k2p2 across ending with k2 row 1 k2p2 across ending with k2 row 2 knit row 2 purl row 3 to 12 repeat row 1 and 2 row 3 to 10 repeat row 1 and 2 five more times four more times 12 row total 10 row total when knitting and bind off complete weave in ends enjoy thanks to eva evamarie on ravelry for her support in writing and testing www ravelry com/designers/steepndeep
